reviews.review_msg: Milan the goat of SFU Computing Science. Professors come and go but god only comes and leaves once. Salute to the best professor you'll ever come across. Really miss him since they kicked him out for some absurd reason. Brilliant professor, actually understand his students and knows the meaning of learning

I was hesitant in taking this course due to the bad reviews. However, one review said that do what you think is right which is what I did. You have to go to the class, and ask questions, he is a very nice professor. the amount of work is very difficult. if you do everything and ask anything you do not know multiple times he will answer.
The GOAT. Just do what you think is right and he will give u good marks. Highly recommend him for 105.
Learning absolutely nothing

Many of the lectures were disorganized and didn't teach much. He likes to give vague instructions for assignments to "teach critical thinking". It made grading pretty unfair since you could lose marks for things you had no way of knowing were nessecary (ie in-person attendance when watching pre-recorded presentations).
Prof was nice but is disorganized. Many assignments to do with vague instructions, but just do what you think is right and you will get full marks. Not too difficult, just lots of work.
Worst proof I've ever had, doesn't teach anything. You never do anything in class.

No matter what course you take with this guy, he'll be unfair to you and will trick you. He is an unfair marker who takes grade appeals but doesn't reply to any. You will keep emailing him about grade changes and errors but in vain of no reply from him. He doesn't bother what's going in his class and will make you cry for genuine marks. Don't take!

Worst Professor you will ever take in your life. Doesn't checks assessments fairly. I really don't get how SFU has still kept him as a professor there. He will mark all the assessments with the highest percentage at the last minute before releasing the final grade and will give you a very low score to decrease class avg. Won't reply to emails later

Amazing effort into lectures, I feel bad for Cristina, she tried to make the class as engaging as possible, but 105 is just a dull class, anyway, she's also very generous and forgiving.
don't focus on the material you write, just focus on following the rubric, thats where the bulk of the marks are

She's a good prof but the CMPT 105W course sucks. I skipped like 5 weeks worth of lectures and missed nothing. The written reports can be a little tricky, make sure you follow guidelines properly and do your citations properly.

Loved the grading scheme as it was very forgiving. She was a nice prof, but I unfortunately did not find much value from the lectures. Prof and TAs were responsive for questions regarding the assignments. Rubric and what to be expected are clearly laid out, was fairly graded as well. Definitely recommend her for a course like 105w.

Good class if you're ok at writing in general. Assignment marks just have random marks taken off by TAs. Lectures can be boring mainly due to course material but Christina is a good prof. Only con is assignments are due before past assignments are marked so sometimes you can make the same mistake in both assignments
Great prof, it's just that the course itself isn't that fun but besides that if u can yap in English u r good to go especially since TAs r more lenient than highschool teachers!

Super nice and great prof, it's just the content of the course which makes it very boring. I only attended like 2-3 lectures because of this. As long as you participate with the discussions on canvas and do well on essays, basically a free A.
Very good professor

Alright prof, found the course to be boring but most bc of the material and not how it was taught. Grading can depend on if it's a TA or not but the prof herself is very generous. She moved around deadlines sometimes which was nice
Extremely easy course. Don't bother showing up to lectures, they're useless.

Would recommend to avoid if you can. Lectures are incredibly boring. She just reads words from the slides, and says nothing important. You will be asked to finish the next part of the assignment before you are given feedback on the last part, and will be penalized for the same mistakes. If you must take her class, lectures are a waste of time.

Class was very boring in general and professor did not have a lot of energy either which made the lectures worse. Assignments are graded weirdly. Lectures felt very useless as well since she doesn't teach and just goes through slides on her powerpoint without really saying anything important.
She's Awesome
Good prof very understanding changed lots of deadlines she is pretty good not going to lie

I personally thought the topics he brought to class were pretty interesting.

 He makes an effort to engage with students through in-class polls, which are rewarded (snacks). He also makes every Friday a movie day, which offers a nice change of pace. 

Lastly he is very caring, I did not have any issues with academic concession.

Most boring prof I've ever had because lectures were just full of yap. Attendance is for grades. Criteria for papers and small assignments are a bit unclear. Final exam is easy, as most people never paid attention in class and only needed a few days of slide reviewing. Grades get scaled at the end of the semester. Quick and helpful email replies.
yap session smh

The class is quite boring in the sense that it's just him going through slides and briefly explaining and then going to another slide about writing. You should show up to class as he does a participation activity at the end. The assignments are two papers and a PPT which are quite annoying. The final is basically 35 MCQ and then 2 long responses.

assignments sometimes got returned by TAs a month (or more) after they were submitted and without any feedback 
assignments are easy if you know how to write essays
lectures are 3hr long, worth 10% of ur mark and are pretty slow, but felix spices them up with kahoots and polls
course isn't "fun" but is easily survivable

incredibly boring class, just talks in a monotone voice for three hours and expects anybody to be interested. assignment instructions are very dull and marking will take the whole semester. the TA's feedback is also incredibly bad and will just deduct marks just cuz the had a bad day. boring class and lecture but cant expect too much from dis class
oh boy. boring class. endless yap. took OVER 2 MONTHS to hand back items. final based on lecture slides. Nice guy, boring class.
Bird course, take it with Felix

The assignments were relatively easy, however, beware of the final. Victor was noticeably angry about the lack of attendance which resulted in the final having incredibly specific questions. The course in general was "uninteresting" for lack of a better term, as many of the concepts learnt were english related or just general CS trivia.

Victor was an okay prof for this class. The lectures were dense and not very engaging but the assignments were pretty easy and graded generously. The final exam was a complete mess, it was filled with random trivia from the lectures that didn't contribute to your communication or writing skills at all. Memorize the random trivia and you'll be fine.

I think that it is crucial to consider the purpose of a course. Does it teaches and tests on practical and relevant knowledge or skills for your future, or is it focused on attending lectures, listening, and memorizing trivial and irrelevant information? Based on 100w, it seems that Victor's course philosophy aligns more with the latter approach.

Mickey mouse class, the assignments are pretty easy, but the final was a joke. He intentionally made the questions in class material heavy due to nobody showing up. The course content was heavily irrelevant and boring. Victor was clearly butt hurt from the lack of attendance. Avoid if you can.

Victor's final exam demanded a high level of detail retention, and the lectures could benefit from being more concise, as it seems like he's prolonging the lectures unnecessarily to fill 3 hours. If u want to commute for 2 hours and spend 3 hours sitting in a lecture hall for very little information every week take this course with professor victor

Victor Cheung put a lot of effort into this course. This is evident in his lectures, and the assignments provided. Grading is largely dependant on a student's ability to fulfill the criteria outlined in assignment rubrics.
not really a fault of the professor, but this course is incredibly boring. It also doesn't help that he recorded the lectures in previous semesters and decided to make those unavailable for watching.
So many memes in lecture. Great guy. Graduated from Waterloo, too, which is very neat.

For his first time teaching this course, he covers the material thoroughly in lectures, and grading is fair and based on writing skill, especially compared to the previous profs who taught this course.

PLEASE never take any course with this guy. He is the worst prof I have ever had in any course. Does not respond to emails. Does not care about students. Yes, the course is very dry, but he does absolutely anything to make it even worse. At the start of the course I really wanted to like this guy, but it just seems like he puts on a persona.

Boring lectures where you learn close to nothing. Everyone I know either does not attend lectures or just shows up to his lectures to do other work. 
But he makes 10% of the grade "participation marks" where you HAVE to show up for lectures to do these in class assignments, ridiculous.
If I am being generous, I would call them a terrible prof.

Herbert Tsang is okay-ish but CMPT 105W is just a bad course. He gives lectures, he assigns assignments, and the course just goes on. He gets an unfair amount of blame here, but he's not great either. He makes you find and meet 4 other classmates for some group work worth ~5% of the grade, and does in-class participation activities for marks.
Very little to learn from this course. He gave us a 185 mark final with only 80 minutes to complete the exam but his marking was fair. He gave feedback on the assignments which was quite helpful.

Overall an awful human being. Bragged about charging students $20 to use his staplers if they forgot to staple their work. Rarely answers emails. Some TAs mark like you're in an essay writing contest, and others are super chill. No consistency. Assignments unclear. CMPT 105W itself is a easy class, can't imagine having Tsang in Calculus or smt.
this guy is worse than milan tofiloski, genuinely dont know how he has a rating above a 2
I don't understand what he wants for the assignments. His words are unclear. The more he talks, the more confusing everything becomes.

Generally not a nice guy. Doesn't care whatsoever about this class at all. Total joke of a course, and I don't think he completly understands how much of a circus that this is. He is lazy and lies a lot about generally inconsequential things. Assignment sheets have a lot of mistakes. Some TA's mark much harder than others

He's coming to get you. His lectures were useless but at least I could do other stuff during his lecture period. On the bright side, you could get a good grade if you have highschool level english. Bro brought his kid to the lecture. GL  AND ENJOY YOUR FREE GRADE

The professor possessed exceptional academic qualifications & demonstrated great enthusiasm in delivering each lecture throughout the course. The only abomination that I had were his tough-as-nails TAs, who exhibited an extraordinary level of strictness in grading the assignments as they were responsible for evaluating and assessing them.

Pointless lectures that bore you to death. Since he gave marks for attendance, I always did my other coursework during his lectures and finished most, so that's a W. If you don't want the 5% something mark for attendance then don't attend the lectures and just do the only 3 assignments he have at home. He was nice but the lectures weren't.

Herbert is an interesting critter that's for sure.His lectures are utterly pointless and a waste of time. His credentials are valid however teaching skills are not included in that range.The final exam is equivalent to an international literacy test and is almost entirely unrelated to the course content.His old-minded ways add to his incompetence.

The class is easy but the lectures are useless. herbert forces random participation marks forcing you to attend. I mean he tries to make his lectures engaging but at the same time he can be very picky. Not a terrible experience and assignments are returned fast, i suggest you do work for other classes in his lectures so you dont waste 3 hours/week

Beware of Herbert! The class itself is easy but he loves overcomplicating the content. Most of the content is common sense but he makes in-person activities which count to 5% of your grade, forcing you to go to lectures. Final was easy but time got reduced to 1hr and with each question being locked after answering, I got forced to rush through it.
He loves taking students prisoner in his class room. You can't leave until he says.... Very scary I almost cried and broke down in class

It's just like the other students said, he is a hilariously childish man. Take the course if you're fine sacrificing 5-10% for participation marks, because the lectures will make you lose brain cells. It's also such an easy course, all assignments I was able to do within 5 hours.

A very problematic instructor. His lectures are very egoistic. Not a lot of useful materials are talked about during class. He would pretend to encourage asking questions, but then ridicule anyone who actually dared to ask. Seems like he really doesn't want to answer any questions at all.

this class is pointless enough for anyone who has a basic knowledge of english and writing. this guy is insufferable and childish. definitely avoid if you can! the class itself isn't bad, it's easy and the knowledge is very intuitive.
Course content is boring but he makes it even more dry than it already is
Worst Prof ever. Not recommended at all. He makes the 100 level course to 400

Herbert is a jolly fellow. He genuinely cares about his students and hopes that they will do great things. I'm enjoying his class so far, thought the curriculum is not so useful. It's just a W course. I think he is fairly straightforward and the assignments are manageable.

Had him in Fall 2022. His teaching was pre bad and almost nothing he taught us was tested in the final exam (which was a joke of an exam, was quite literally a grade 4 English grammar test with fill in the blanks and mcqs). He was also picky with essay topics and I had to find 7 different topics before he approved of the one I chose in the end.

He spent 10 minutes complaining about how Rate My Prof is dumb and everyone that writes reviews are just bitter that they didn't do well. He then spent the entire term proving every negative review right.
Class wasn't hard though.

As the person below said, the exam was incredibly easy. The course didn't have much new to offer if you took any English courses in high school. Lectures are pretty much just going through the slides which you can do on your own time with little missed content. He seems like a good guy, just don't bank on this course being too enjoyable.

Herbert is okay, but its a joke of a course, nothing taught in class had any relation to the essays written, which we researched on our own. The Final consisted of multiple choice for which word best fits in the sentence, or being able tor read graphs. I wouldn't count on future offerings of this course being so easy though.

Good lecturer with minimal stutters and no accent.

I don't know why people say the lectures are boring. Just imagine its a movie, you don't need to take any notes. You can literally show up without a pencil.

The late penalties are 10% per day. I ate a lot of late penalties.

The formatting of the assignments are marked harshly.

Probably one of the worst classes I have ever taken. The lectures are boring , the content even more so. The TA's are insufferable. They cut way too many marks for very tiny details while grading rubrics are way toooo vague. Do urself a favor and take this course with any other prof.

Great professor with a good attitude but the lectures were quite boring. Not too many assignments but near the middle and the end of the course there is big papers you have to write. TAs marked very poorly and took off large chunks of your mark for the tiniest things.
Marked very thought, boring lectures, you are expected way more than what is being said, TAs take away big marks for little things. Bad experience
Pretty chills, just make sure you don't mess up the informative and persuasive papers as those are worth essentially your entire grade.
great lectures, extremely boring content, insufferable marking, final was insanely random
Horrible prof for cmpt 105w do not take him. Class average was a b- but the other class had a a- average. Do not take him for cmpt 105w
Majestic speaking voice gosh dilly darn
Puts effort and enthusiasm into even the most simple lectures. Cant go wrong with Dr. Khangura
Exceptionally clear speaker. Reads from PowerPoint slides. I did not use my textbook.

Jacqueline Nelsen is an okay lecturer. Her quizzes are unfair and her assignments are dry and uninteresting. She teaches you what you need to know but you probably won't enjoy the process. I'd recommend taking CMPT105W with a different prof if you can, and leaving extra time in your schedule for essay work if you can't. No final exam for the course

Take if you want an easy pass but annoying class. She relies to heavily on the textbook and rote memorization, rather than actually teaching students useful writing skills through consistent practice. There are many tedious and pointless quizzes/participation work that will make you hate school. 2nd worst class I took at SFU.

She is a genuinely kind person. She didnt give to much schoolwork and was always available to help and was understanding. That said the major drawbacks were her quizzes that were based on her slides and the textbook and were essentially just memorization. And her TAs were kind of mean. But she rounded my high A- to an A and I didnt even ask.

At the beginning of the term, there's 20 or so quizzes which is basically reading comprehension. After that, small stuff like participation (by attending via sign up sheet) and peer reviews account for your mark. No final, only two papers worth a majority of your mark. Four quizzes, with content pulled from lectures, which is from the textbook. EZ

Definitely not as bad as her score would suggest. Her lectures are really boring but necessary as questions for quizzes are pulled straight from her presentations. Lots of short assignments/quizzes on Canvas. Wrote two short essays for the course. Textbook is not necessary. Pretty easy course if you know how to write and read the rubrics correctly.

After seeing Dr. Nelsen's ratings before taking CMPT105 W I definitely was not looking forward to this class. However, Nelsen cared for her students and was a decent teacher. I barely studied for this class and still did well. Also didn't need to read the textbook at all, just go over the powerpoint slides before quizzes. No final, only 2 essays.

Jacqueline Neslen really doesn't deserve all these bad reviews. Sure, the class was pretty pointless but she obviously does really care about her students. The quizzes in her class all memorization of very specific class details, however they really aren't hard if you just pay attention to every lecture. Seriously pretty good and caring prof.

the quizzes are kinda bad lol - you'd assume you'd get graded more on WRITING than MEMORIZATION in a legit WRITING course but nooooo. 20% of your grade is based on pure memory and luck lmfao. also she's very against feedback/suggestions/criticism, like she just refuses to change anything despite giving us this giant feedback survey???? like ok lmao

She's really not that bad. It's a lot of quizzes in the first week or so but then you only have a few bigger projects like essays. Plus there's only 4 quizzes, no final or midterms. The quizzes can be tough with questions that definitely require you to read the textbook, but you can get an ok grade on those and just go hard on the papers. She cares

The class was disorganized and overwhelming at times, but given the circumstances at the time, I can understand why. Jacquie cares a lot and she gives really good feedback when you go to office hour (go, it's helpful). The class was not easy, but if you put the effort in, you'll do great. Read the textbook thoroughly. Tests were tough & specific.

Jacqueline is great. This course can be pretty dry, but she tries to get through the material and made sure we got it. The essay grading criteria is really clear, and if you follow the course structure (do the essay outline, peer review, write final draft), you'll do fine.

The TAs seem to be choosing random student's outlines and essays to criticize and give them low grades. Quizzes seem to require a good memory as compared to a good understanding of the material. Overall, one of the worst classes that I have taken.

This class isn't really a gpa booster, it required more work than I anticipated. Got above average in most of the essays/tests and final grade got scaled in my favour. First years couldn't handle this course and constantly complained about every little mistake. It was a bit unorganized but the profs rough drafts/essays helped improve my writing.

Class average ended up as a B+ when I took this course in Fall 2020. The course isn't extremely difficult, however the reasons why you lose marks in the first place are infuriating and non-sensical. Read the other posts as they are completely valid complaints.

My writing abilities have gone down since taking this class. She constantly contradicts herself about what good writing is. I went to her office hours asking for help, shed tell me what to write then the day after would call the part she told me to write is garbage. Her exams are not related to studying its just pure luck on what you will get.

The prof expects you to memorize almost every little detail of your textbook, and every detail and spoken word from her. On the final, one question was What is my favorite video of all time? She lacks transparency in her rubrics and cant tell you everything shes grading you on.

She is very textboo0k heavy. She doesn't give many details. On the Final for Fall 2020 she asked "What was the instructor's favourite video". I did not know we had to study personal details about her. She also does not know a thing about computer science and teaches us ENGINEERING material. She does not give relevant information at all.

We never had projects based on the material. We had two essays where she had us peer review after we submitted rendering the feedback useless. She graded outlines two days before the essays were due making the feedback useless. The final had questions about her and required memorization not comprehension. This class should not be this hard to pass.

Pros: Tries to be relatable and uplifting Cons: Everything else lol, tests you on personal information (her dog's names, favourite youtube video, etc), tests/quizes are extremely difficult because you're required to memorize specific examples shown/said in class + specific lines from the textbook. You don't know which ones, so memorize it all lol

The course was disorganized since some rubrics for essays were copypasted and not elaborated on. Tests are very difficult, unrewarding those who studied course material (e.g. questions such as: "what is the instructor's favourite video" may appear on a test) requiring inane amount of memorization. A link between TAs and the prof. didn't exist.

pros about this prof: she is energetic, and she tries to relate with her students and be more interesting. The downsides are that she is very disorganized, and her tests are extremely difficult due to the need to memorize an entire textbook and items mentioned in lectures. Assignment criteria was all over the place and often not clear.

Fall 2020 CMPT105W with Nelsen was am an absolute nightmare. Unrealistic expectations from students, and probably one of the worst final exams ever made. 35 mins to do a 50 MC question exam with no ability to review questions. Do not take this class with her.
Final exam for Fall 2020 was absolutely scuffed. If you want to do well in this class, be prepared to literally absorb the textbook into your brain.

Try to avoid registering for a class taught by Jacqueline. Her cmpt 105w is a very heavy class with a ton of textbook readings, assignments, and pointless peer views. The peer review for the first essay was done after we submitted it so the feedback was useless. The second peer review our feedback was locked on canvas so we again did it for nothing

Imagine being a computing science student, taking quizzes and midterms with questions like: "as an engineer, what is the most important..." and memorizing numerous engineering-exclusive concepts. Imagine reading an entire textbook that constantly preaches how important the textbook is to ENGINEERS, while full of engineering jargon. I DON'T CARE.

Prof doesn't let people go back on quizzes or final, 35 min final, less time than our midterm and she didn't even tell us the format until very late and kept flip flopping about what the final is. Avoid this prof. Terrible prof.

+cheerful mood, organized course page -heavily textbook reliant if you want to pass the course(tests and exams) participation counts for marks as well, extra marks for students who participate a lot in the discussion pages tries to ensure you're always up-to-date(check your email!)

This class is truly horrible. The class requires you to read a textbook and memorize it completely. question on the midterm, final and quizzes include questions like, "What page is table 2.3b on?" and "What page are the rhetorical pattern methods talked about?". Be prepared to memorize the whole textbook if you want to get a good mark.

A miracle that she has a PhD, the level of grammar in her emails are that of an ESL student. Teaches straight out of an engineering textbook for comp sci students. The other reviews will tell you just how bad her quizzes and midterms are. Just don't take this prof. Completely incompetent.

Does multiple-choice quizzes except the questions are about absurdly specific details in the textbook. It's a very poor way to test knowledge and it seems as though there's no way to properly prepare unless you memorize every word in the textbook.

No need to scroll any further, I'll make it simple for you. If you don't have to take this prof, don't. If you do have to take a course with this prof, I wish you the best of luck, prepare for anything and everything.

I like her as a person but that does not change the fact that she's simply a bad professor. The midterm and quizzes are multiple-choice and test for memorization, not ability. Essays are graded harshly but not unreasonable. Read the other reviews. Not much more I can say except she is really really bad.
Assigns peer reviews after essays are due and does not allow the newly received feedback to be used. Also read all the other reviews.

the content she teaches is completely useless. why am i being forced to memorize an entire textbook that has no correlation to comp sci. essays are marked harshly and the quizzes are not fair. expect to memorize literally every single sentence of a 350 pg textbook when u take this course. as a person shes chill but this isnt rate my person

Memorize all 300+ pages of the textbook or fail. Quiz/Exam all based on memorization - down to the letter/graph/table on specific pages. Essays have very specific and unorganized rubrics, hard to get a good mark. Utterly disastrous and annoying professor. Terrible in every aspect, shouldn't be allowed to teach. Read the other reviews.

The incompetence of this professor is beyond what I believed was ever possible: the course material was littered with contraditions, and her emails reeked of unprofessionalism as they were full of typos. While the course went on, this litter spread like wildfire, and soon the entire course reeked of the rancid aroma radiating from her bad attitude.

Where do I even begin LOL. She's very disorganized and does not know how to test students well. For a technical writing course in computer science, we learned how to write as an engineer? The quizzes and midterms are completely mc and ask for random obscure sentences in the textbook. Essays are marked rather harshly; very few people get over 80%

Before this class, be sure to bring a pillow because you're gonna be falling asleep 2 min into lecture. Don't forget to bring a pillow for your pillow because your pillow is gonna fall asleep as well.

I'm not even sure where to start, this prof is far from fit to teach this course, let alone teach at all. She speeds through lecture content, which I doubt she understands herself. The rubrics for every assignment are utterly disorganized and information is always contradicting. She also expects you to memorize the entire textbook for exams.

Terrible Prof. She taught this class in 2 sections, and she gave a lot of information to one that she didn't to the other, we heard about it FROM those students in the previous class. She gave a crazy amount of quizzes in the beginning and her quizzes are the most random, precise sentences from a an engineering book. Not a good fit for this course!

Do I even need to explain why? Read the reviews in her Langara profile on this site. This class is useless. Nothing computer science related, all memorization and essays. She doesnt even have a PHD in CS. Avoid at all costs. Maybe shes different in person? Change my mind after Covid is gone.
